item.title: GNU Parallel replacement string for filename without path and filetype is '{/.}'
item.description:
Pontifications

  • If you don't want the filepath and you don't want the filetype use {/.} which is the "Basename of input line without extension." according to the man page.

  • example:

cd /home/roland/GIT/rt-mozlando2018-ksc/264x176
parallel convert {} -resize 264x176! 264x176-{/.}.png ::: ../ORIGINALS/*.jpg    
mkdir MONOCHROME ; cd !$
parallel convert {} -monochrome monochrome-{/.}.gif ::: ../*.png

  • previous blog posts about parallel:

    • Use GNU Parallel instead of xargs to run a script on wildcards and a file that is a list of files
    • GNU Parallel to use all your CPU cores

item.title: Use Tag Wranglers on SUMO like Archive of Our Own?!?
item.description:
Pontifications

  • The Tag Wrangling on Archive of our own sounds amazing in Wired's article: Fans are better than tech at organizing information online.
  • Would love to use it on SUMO questions.

Pontifications

  • Gotta try Andy's create issue on Github in a private repo as a ToDo list.
  • I've tried everything else :-)

item.title: Fido APN settings for Lenovo C630 Yoga since autodetect doesn't work probably because this computer was never sold in Canada
item.description:
Pontifications

  • If you insert a SIM card, then from "Fido Stephen"'s Fidoâ€™s APN & MMS Settings all you need is to create an APN called:
    LTEMOBILE.APN
  • That's it, that's all :-) MMS settings not required!

item.title: Open Multiple URLs Firefox Add-on by Firefox user 12363525
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Since I can't get Launchy on ARM64 Windows 10 to work, I am opening multiple URLs using the following Firefox Add-on:
    • Open Multiple URLs Firefox Add-on by Firefox user 12363525 <--- it is slower than Launchy but good enough for now.

item.title: The Launchy Ruby gem doesn't launch Firefox on Windows 10 build 1903 ARM64
item.description:
Pontifications

  • It works great on x86 Windows 10!
  • Maybe this is related to Accessing WSL files from File Explorer using \wsl$\Ubuntu appears to be broken in ARM64 Windows 10 Builds on Windows 10 Build 1903
  • Again, perhaps some kind of P9 issue?

item.title: rt-kits-api2 second version of my SUMO API code, now with daily CSV :-)
item.description:
Pontifications

  • rt-kits-api2 is the second version of my KITSUNE API code (first version was https://github.com/rtanglao/rt-kitsune-api/ )
  • Instead of MongoDB, I'll use one CSV file per UTC day (daily CSV files for: June 2019, May 2019) which will allow easy importing into R, SQLite etc

item.title: New SUMO Kitsune questions API: created and updated less than and greater than for created and updated fields
item.description:
Pontifications

  • New to me but available since March in the fix to issue 3481: New SUMO Kitsune questions API: created and updated less than and greater than. Previously: Kitsune Questions aka AAQ API, product == 'firefox' is desktop, 'mobile' is Firefox for android
  • See it in action in my code
  • Or in Nancy's code: search for updated_lt and updated_gt

item.title: When in doubt go to bed! <--- gleaned from Microcosmographia lv: The Discipline
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Microcosmographia lv: The Discipline <--- I'll never structure my day like this (or in any sort of regime inspired by or copied from monks even if it is from Anathem by Neal Stephenson which is one my favourites) but the sleep advice is obvious but great.

item.title: The Art of Command Line
item.description:
Pontifications

  • jlevy: The Art of Command Line is an amazing summary of command line capabilities. It mentions parallel and other fine commands but doesn't mention mlr aka miller.
